alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin; Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 21 at 1:34PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM EST TUESDAY THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall, with locally higher amounts, will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Fayette IN, Franklin IN, Union IN and Wayne. In Ohio, Butler, Clark, Greene, Montgomery and Preble. * WHEN...From 1 AM EST Tuesday through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
